description: It shows even where I am.
'Very' limited choice of locations. Could've been nice, especially since it's one of the most basic apps, but the devs decided to ruin this. Good job.

Its solid, but it does not contain my cities or a lot of other cities weathers. Please use online services to retrieve the weather or create a small db with locations, the current solution in libgweather is not viable.
summary: Does not contain my cities weather

description: Canada is not an option with this app.
summary: The entirity of Canada is missing

description: No weather data available for the Philippines at all, so it isn't useful unfortunately.
totally useless preinstalled app.

It keeps giving me weather data starting from tomorrow
Also would prefer configuration options for daily/hourly default view change.

Like many other reviewers said, this app lacks maaaaany locations, including giant swathes of very very populated areas.

There's no excuse for it lacking so many locations other than laziness, or pettiness.
Would love to use this thing integrated so nicely into my computer, but it thinks my home doesn't exist.
It would be nice to have an option to make the daily view the default instead of the hourly view. I generally don't need that granular amount of detail.
it does't support iranian cites

Tells you the temperature outside along with the weather condition. Might be nice to lay out the hourly view in an easier to scroll format. Could use precipitation percentages, air quality, and other minutiae.
summary: Does what it says on the tin

When I enter the Cities I want the weather for and click on the refresh button, it doesn't get the weather data.
works great.i haven't had any trouble with it at all.
summary: Great App and i do recommend it

description: Great app if used properly. Though I would like some more customization options.
Entering the city name does not result in the app displaying weather data, it just does nothing at all.
While other countries and cities outside the Belarus this applet serves pretty well. A little Gnome's chauvinist?
works just fine

description: As others said, it just says "Forecast not available"

When the application is opened, it correctly identifies my location, but says "forecast not available." If I manually search for a city (including my own), it will bring up results for that location properly.

It used to immediately bring up the right results automatically. It broke several months ago IIRC. Needs to be fixed soon.
Forecast not available unless you live in a city, no use to me, deleted
Doesnt seem to work
summary: Forecast is not available for any location I select

description: It always just says forecast not available.
no forecast data

My city is listed in the weather website. I can click on it and see current and forecasted weather. Yet, when I search for my city name in the weather app (Gnome, Fedora 31), it shows the name as "city-name, city-name" (not as city-name, state or just the city-name). When I click on the name, the App shows "--" where it should show the city name, so, it doesn't recognizes it. And the weather info is different on the app than on the website (temperature off by one or two degrees, celcius).
summary: Can't find my location, even when it is listed in the weather website

description:
Working as should. Beautiful weather app that shows accurate info.

I don't understand so many people not knowing to adjust the preferences but knowing to give one star.
It doesn't seem to get location from geoclue, but I was able to type in a location and it pulled information for there and integrated into the gnome clock/calendar. Good enough for me.
its works fine the app works fine

So, this app has a lot of problems. For one, it incorrectly assumes my location *and keeps that incorrect location* as the default. The city I live in, when searched, exists, but upon loading, there is no actual information. Everything is just blank and refreshing does absolutely nothing.

The UI is kind of lacking - you get two days worth of forecast. It should be at least 4, I'd think. It's not hard to scrape data from Weather.com or something. There's not extended forecast. Also there are no options to change colors, which is annoying because the Adwaita dark theme it uses JUST ON THE BUTTONS looks terrible. Basically, GNOME needs to streamline this app's UI but I doubt that will happen anytime soon.

Don't use. You're better off just going to Weather.com or something.
My town is not even available in this app.
summary: Only a few Ukraine towns in list

description:
1) Wrong forecast
2) Can't track exact location and give details according to it

description: I have tried several different weather apps for Ubuntu and this is the best one I have used so far, it is a simple interface and also shows the weather in the notification centre all the time.

Working fine for our small town. Nice work!

description: I typed in my town's name and state in full, it said "Searching"...then nothing. If there was a clear indication that it's really doing something, I wouldn't be so annoyed. As far as I'm concerned, I'll stick with the widget on my phone.

description:
The app needs better locating. It does not have data for a lot of small places even though the palce is shown in the search results.

Other than that, it is a good app with capable and simple design.

description:
The biggest pro is also its biggest con. It's really simple.

Really nice to look up the weather quickly but there aren't a lot of options beside that really. It does what it does though and it looks gorgeous.

description: This app could have been a good one but it's unstable and buggy. The app lacks many UX features, utilization of the space is bad. Not enough information and not enough customization. I know it's supposed to be "simple" but this is way too simple for even the most beginners.

Needs a remake

nice installation and use, detect our location automaticaly and using is very userfraindly

description:

description:

Doesn't work properly, selecting location is broken. It's amazing that Ubuntu don't have any working weather application.

Just doesn't work. Tried in Gnome, Budgie, and XFCE - the app seems to work but it can't pull any weather data. Strangely, it will pull the current temperature and precipitation for my area but nothing else, the rest is blank.
It seems that this app is not maintained anymore. No forecast data is displayed.
Worked great in Leap but just stopped since I transitioned to Tumbleweed. Removing it.

It's got a very good-looking GUI (typical of GNOME software), but most of the time it simply doesn't do it's job for reasons that I don't really understand because it doesn't give any useful information when it has a problem (typical of GNOME software). This kind of pattern recurring throughout the GNOME project as a whole, I'm sad to say, is driving me away from using their packages.
summary: Looks nice and presents data well, on the odd occasion when it works

description: seems the project is dead
Thank you for this awesome app

After upgrading to 21.04, the gnome weather app would not show any forecast ... it just spun around. Weirdly, launching from terminal as gnome-weather worked.
I had the flatpak version installed. I removed it, and reinstalled from the ubuntu repositories. This is version 3.36, much older, but it works.
Simple and to the point. Just remember to turn on location services under privacy settings.

Das Norwegische Metereologische Institut, von dem die Wetterdaten geholt werden, würde für jedes Kaff das aktuelle Wetter liefern, wenn die App nicht das Fragen verlernt hätte (mit der Umstellung auf GTK 4 ?) .

Las preferencias son las justas y necesarias, no necesita ninguna otra configuración. Simple, elegante (sobretodo con dark theme) y muy útil.

description: Cualquier cosa es mas útil. Vivo en Las Palmas de Gran Canaria y me da los detalles de meteorología de Getafe y no hay forma de modificar la ciudad o la localización a donde vivo, o sea inútil total.

anda de 10, espectacular

Seria interesante disponer en la misma app con control de mareas y fases lunares, ademas de datos mas completos sobre meteorología.
El pronóstico meteorológico dejo de funcionar. Pronóstico no disponible.
porque en la ultima versión (a semanas de saacr gnome v40) no anda?, en mi caso reconoce la ubicación pero no da prognosticos y no lo muestra como suele hacer en el area de notificación...
Da el clima actual pero no da pronostico, la extension weather in the clock no se complementa con ella.
La app se queda en cargando y tengo un buen internet.
Esta bueno la Aplicación pero no tiene mi ciudad.

Es injusto porque la app es buena y si les funciona mal en Ubuntu, esa misma es la razón, es porque están usando UBUNTU!

description:
J'ai beaucoup cherché une application météo valable et stable surtout, j'ai fini par choisir celle-ci. Hé oui! Gnome a dans son catalogue d'applications une qui donne la météo, mais oui, mais c'est bien sûr, mais pourquoi n'y avais-je pas pensé plus tôt! 
Celle-ci fonctionne bien, avec quelques défauts malheureusement, on ne peut pas par exemple afficher la température dans la barre de notification, et les informations météo se réduisent à un pictogramme qui résume la situation actuelle (soleil, nuages, pluie, etc) et en dessous la température, et c'est tout. Les prévisions sont sur 5 jours avec la température attendue et le pictogramme adéquat. Sinon pour ce qui est de la sélection d'une ville pour la localisation, c'est très facile, on se géolocalise automatiquement si l'on veut, mais un seul choix à la fois, alors voilà une autre lacune c'est que l'on a pas la possibilité de mettre en mémoire plusieurs lieux différents pour les avoir sur un même tableau, ensemble, et lire les informations d'un seul coup. Bref c'est minimaliste, mais si l'on est pas trop exigent, et si la force du vent ou la concentration d'UV ne vous tracassent pas plus que ça, alors cette app est ce qu'il vous faut.
summary: Une application météo qui fonctionne bien

Ne fonctionne pas
Donne aucune météo

Libre et gratuité oblige, il n'y aura sans doute jamais de contrat avec des entreprises spécialisées. L'application dépend donc, pour ses données, de l'institut météorologique norvégien, qui doit proposer beaucoup moins d'informations que ce que l'on trouve chez la concurrence : météo, températures par heure ou sur les prochains jours, humidité et vitesse du vent (uniquement dans la vue par jour). Et c'est à peu près tout. En comparaison, l'équivalent sous Windows 10 indique également la visibilité, le point de rosée, l'heure de lever et coucher du soleil et de la lune (ainsi que les phases pour cette dernière), le pourcentage de précipitations, l'indice UV, les précipitations sur les 30 derniers jours, quelques infos sur les records de précipitations ou de température pour le lieu... Même chose sous macOS, qui affiche en plus une carte météo de l'Europe et va même jusqu'à donner la qualité de l'air.

Par contre, le reproche que l'on peut faire, concernant la partie sur laquelle les développeurs avaient le contrôle, c'est la nécessité de faire plusieurs clics pour obtenir certaines informations (vue séparée par heure et par jour, puis encore un clic supplémentaire pour obtenir certaines informations, comme la vitesse du vent), là où les autres plateformes proposent des vues uniques qui arrivent à rester claires et facilement lisibles, tout en proposant bien plus d'informations 😕
summary: Application plutôt basique, qui devrait suffire à la plupart des gens

Полезное приложение! Точно показывает погоду, есть возможность посмотреть погоду на близжайшие несколько часов прямо из центра уведомлений. Присутствует показ температуры по Цельсия или Фаренгейт. Для работы нужно просто ввести своё местоположение (также присутствует погода по текущему местоположению). Простой, красивый и лаконичный интерфейс Ставлю все 5 звёзд!
